content: girl s poncho copyright august 2004 eileen tepper changes made june 2006 this pattern was somewhat complicated for me to write please if you have any questions or comments feel free to e-mail me stitches used v_stitch = double_crochet chain 1 double_crochet x is the amount of beginning chain must be divisible by 4 ex 136 y is x ÷ 4 - 1 ex 33 in my example i used caron simply soft which is finer than other worsted weight yarns a size g-6 hook and cast on 136 stitches if i remember correctly i do not want to give actual numbers for chains etc i want you to be able to use any yarn any size hook etc just figure out how many chains to start with must be divisible by 4 and then what y is and go this pattern is fairly simple and i believe it will be just as easy to read and work without having to know exactly how many v-stitches and 3dc groupings there are in each row it will be obvious keep in mind that there are two points one in the front and one in the back this is where the increases happen in each row chain x join with slip_stitch in beginning chain being sure not to twist round 1 chain 4 counts as 1 double_crochet and chain 1 double_crochet in same st v-st made * chain 1 skip next chain double_crochet y times* skip next chain chain 1 v-st in next st repeat * to * slip_stitch in chain 3 of beg chain 4 to join round 2 slip_stitch into next chain 1 space chain 3 2 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 1 in same space * skip next double_crochet and chain 1 space and in next double_crochet 3dc ch1 * repeat until v-st of previous round in v-st 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 1 repeat * to * until joining at the top of beginning chain round 3 slip_stitch in next double_crochet chain 4 double_crochet in same st v-st made chain 1 skip double_crochet in next chain 2 space v-st *chain 1 skip next double_crochet v-st in next double_crochet the middle of the 3 **skip next 2 double_crochet v-st in next double_crochet the middle of the 3 chain 1 repeat from ** until next chain 2 space back point * v-st repeat * to * until joining round 4 slip_stitch into chain 1 space chain 3 2 double_crochet in same space chain 1 3 double_crochet chain 1 in each v-st chain 1 space in front and back points 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 1 join repeat rounds 3 and 4 until desired length is reached do not end round 1 chain 1 single_crochet in same st and in each double_crochet and chain 1 space around 2 single_crochet in the chain 2 spaces join round 2 chain 1 single_crochet in same st *skip next single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet* around in points single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet
